title: MI5 in the Great War
description:
Nigel West, "MI5 in the Great War"

ISBN: 1849546703 | 2014 | EPUB | 464 pages | 578 KB

In 1921, MI5 commissioned a comprehensive, top-secret review of the organisation's operations during the First World War.

Never intended for circulation outside of the government, all seven volumes of this fascinating and unique document remained locked away in MI5's registry ... until now. Recently declassified and published here for the first time, MI5 in the Great War is filled with detailed, and previously undisclosed, accounts centring on the Security Service's activities during the conflict.

The main narrative examines MI5's various attempts to both manage and detect double agents; the detection and execution of enemy spies; its study of German pre-war espionage; and the Kaiser's personal network of spies seeking to infiltrate British intelligence.
